Koalicija za ukinitev dopolnilnega zavarovanja
Nadomestila naj bi ga obvezna pavšalna dajatev, ki naj ne bi bila višja od zneska dopolnilnega zavarovanja pred zadnjo podražitvijo, to je okoli 31 evrov.
05 Nov 2019, 14:46 by STA, T. K.
LJUBLJANA – Minister za zdravje Aleš Šabeder je predstavnikom koalicije danes predstavil predlog za ukinitev dopolnilnega zdravstvenega zavarovanja in uvedbo obvezne pavšalne dajatve. Stranke predlog, ki je le prvi korak k prenovi plačevanja zavarovanja, načeloma podpirajo in se strinjajo, da ga v postopek vloži vlada. Pričakovati je, da bo predlog novele zakona o zdravstvenem varstvu in zdravstvenem zavarovanju, ki predvideva ukinitev dopolnilnega zavarovanja, najprej romal na ekonomsko-socialni svet (ESS), vlada pa bi ga zatem poslala v parlamentarni postopek.Po predlogu bi obvezno pavšalno dajatev plačevale vse poklicne in starostne skupine, ki so že doslej plačevale dopolnilno zdravstveno zavarovanje, dodatno pa bi vključili tudi okoli 100.000 prebivalcev, ki dopolnilnega zavarovanja zdaj ne plačujejo. Natančnega seznama slednjih še nimajo, vendar na ministrstvu ocenjujejo, da je to predvsem mlajša populacija, ki vstopa v aktivno dobo, ter en del starejše populacije, je v državnem zboru (DZ) pojasnil Šabeder. Višina nove obvezne dajatve je po njegovih navedbah še stvar razprave koalicijskih partnerjev. A po sedanjih predvidevanjih ne bo presegala višine prispevka, ki smo ga plačevali pred zadnjo podražitvijo dopolnilnega zavarovanja, to je okoli 31 evrov. Dajatev bodo odvajali od neto plače oz. prejemka, stekala pa se bo na Zavod za zdravstveno zavarovanje Slovenije (ZZZS) v obvezno zdravstveno zavarovanje. Košarica pravic se po ministrovih zagotovilih ne bo spreminjala. Prav tako zagotavlja, da je predlog finančno vzdržen.Šabeder je poudaril, da z načinom odtegljaja od neto plače ne bodo dodatno obremenjevali prispevkov delodajalcev in delojemalcev. To je ena bistvenih razlik predloga v primerjavi s predlogom Levice, o katerem bosta v sredo razpravljala pristojna parlamentarna odbora. Glede na napovedi koalicije je pričakovati, da bo predlog zavrnjen, kar pa bo, kot kaže, zapečatilo sodelovanje Levice z vlado. Predlog ministrstva za ukinitev dopolnilnega zdravstvenega zavarovanja bo po predvidevanjih začel veljati z začetkom leta 2021, dotlej pa bi pripravili še solidarnostno lestvico plačevanja dajatve in zakon o dolgotrajni oskrbi, ki bo prav tako najverjetneje prinesel novo dajatev. Predloga zakona pa v parlamentarnem postopku glede na postopke še ni pričakovati v letošnjem letu.
Je res v bazenu voda?
Po besedah poslanca LMŠ Roberta Pavšiča jim bo to, da bo predlog vložila vlada, olajšalo kar nekaj postopkov, predvsem predstavitev predloga ESS in javno razpravo. Pavšič je odgovoril tudi na ponedeljkove očitke koordinatorja Levice Luke Mesca, da s predlogom skačejo v bazen brez vode: »Skačemo v bazen z vodo, bazen je zelo stabilen, mnogo bolj kot tisti, ki ga predlaga Levica. Zagotavlja vzdržnost ne le za ta mandat, ampak za nekaj naslednjih.« Vodja poslancev SD Matjaž Han je v opozoril na dogovor koalicije, da bodo ukinili dopolnilno zdravstveno zavarovanje, a da ne bodo zmanjšali dostopnosti do zdravstva. Na vprašanje postopnosti sprejemanja teh rešitev pa je odgovoril, da se po njegovem mnenju lahko v tej fazi dogovorijo tudi o solidarnostni lestvici ter sprejmejo zakon v prihodnjem letu. Osebno mu je pomembno, da čim prej sprejmejo zakon s stabilno finančno konstrukcijo in uredijo solidarnostno plačevanje. Če je to možno narediti v enem koraku, bi bil za to. Han je ob tem spomnil, da imajo zdaj na mizi delovno gradivo in da se zakoni lahko tudi spreminjajo. Šabedra bodo tako povabili na srečanje in se o tem resno pogovarjali.Tudi vodja poslancev SAB Maša Kociper meni, da so prenos dopolnilnega zavarovanja v obvezno določili že v koalicijski pogodbi. To rešitev v SAB podpirajo, če bo celo cenejša za državljane, pa bo po njenih navedbah še boljše. Po mnenju SAB je tudi primerno, da tako pomemben zakon vloži vlada in da se z njim seznani ESS. Sedanji predlog pomeni postopen prehod v celovito ureditev tega vprašanja na način, ki ima dovolj politične podpore. Glede primernosti postopnega urejanja tega vprašanja pa je poudarila, da se o ukinitvi dopolnilnega zavarovanja govori že dolgo, nikoli pa se to ni zgodilo, ker je to tako kompleksno področje.Poslanec SMC Jani Möderndorfer je prav tako opozoril na poskuse v preteklosti, da bi to vprašanje naenkrat celovito uredili, na koncu »pa so lobiji dosegli svoje in do ukinitve dopolnilnega zavarovanja nismo prišli«. Kot je pojasnil, je na koalicijskem srečanju opozoril, da je treba določiti dinamiko naslednjih korakov in sam za zdaj verjame, da bo do tega prišlo. Sicer pa je izpostavil, da predlog ministrstva za ukinitev dopolnilnega zavarovanja manj obremenjuje gospodarstvo.V Desusu se za zdaj glede predloga ministrstva še niso opredelili.

Coalition to abolish supplementary insurance
It is to be compensated by a compulsory lump sum charge, which should not exceed the amount of the supplementary insurance before the last rise in price, ie around EUR 31.
05 Nov 2019, 14:46 by STA, T.K.
LJUBLJANA - Health Minister Ales Saber today presented a proposal to the coalition to abolish supplementary health insurance and introduce a mandatory flat-rate tax. The parties, which are only the first step in the renewal of insurance payments, in principle support and agree that it is submitted by the government. It is expected that the proposed amendment to the Health Care and Health Insurance Act, which provides for the abolition of supplementary insurance, will first make a pilgrimage to the Economic and Social Council (ESS), and the government would then send it to parliamentary procedure. occupational and age groups that have previously paid supplementary health insurance, and would additionally include about 100,000 people who do not currently pay supplementary health insurance. They do not yet have a precise list of the latter, but the ministry estimates that this is primarily a younger population entering the active age, and one part of the older population, explained the National Assembly (DZ). The amount of the new mandatory levy is, according to him, a matter for discussion by coalition partners. However, according to current estimates, it will not exceed the amount of the contribution we paid before the last increase in supplementary insurance, which is around 31 euros. The benefit will be deducted from the net salary or salary. and will go to the Health Insurance Institute of Slovenia (ZZZS) for compulsory health insurance. The Basket of Rights, according to the Minister's assurances, will not change. He also assures that the proposal is financially sustainable. Schabeder stressed that the deduction from the net wage would not put an additional burden on employers 'and employees' contributions. This is one of the essential differences between the proposal and the proposal of the Left, which will be debated by parliamentary committees on Wednesday. According to coalition forecasts, the proposal is expected to be rejected, which appears to seal Levica's involvement with the government. The ministry's proposal to abolish supplementary health insurance is expected to enter into force from the beginning of 2021, with a solidarity scale for the payment of benefits and a long-term care law likely to bring a new benefit. However, the draft law is not yet expected in the parliamentary procedure this year.
Is water really in the pool?
According to LMS MP Robert Pavšič, the fact that the proposal will be submitted by the government will facilitate a number of procedures, in particular the presentation of the ESF proposal and public discussion. Pavšič also responded to Monday's remarks by Levica coordinator Luke Mesca that they were jumping into a pool without water: "We are jumping into a pool with water, the pool is very stable, much more than the one proposed by Levica. It provides sustainability not only for this term, but for the next few. ”SD leader Matjaz Han recalled the coalition's agreement to abolish supplementary health insurance but not to reduce access to health care. Asked about the gradual adoption of these solutions, he said that in his opinion, they could also agree on a solidarity scale and pass a law next year. It is personally important for him to pass a law with a stable financial structure and arrange solidarity payments as soon as possible. If it can be done in one step, it would be for that. Han also recalled that they now have work materials on the table and that laws may also change. Shabedra will be invited to the meeting and discussed seriously. The leader of the SAB, Masha Kociper, believes that the transfer of supplementary insurance was obligatory already stipulated in the coalition agreement. The solution is supported by the SAB, and if it is even cheaper for citizens, it will be even better. According to the SAB, it is also appropriate that such a significant law be tabled by the government and made known to the ESF. The current proposal represents a gradual transition to a comprehensive settlement of this issue in a way that has sufficient political support. Regarding the expediency of gradual regulation of this issue, she stressed that the termination of supplementary insurance had been talked about for a long time, but it never happened because it is such a complex area. SMC Member Jani Möderndorfer also recalled attempts in the past to At one point, the issue was comprehensively resolved, but in the end "the lobbies reached theirs and we did not reach the end of supplementary insurance." He explained at the coalition meeting that he needed to determine the dynamics of the next steps, and for now he believes that this will happen. He also stressed that the ministry's proposal to abolish supplementary insurance is less burdensome for the economy. Desus has not yet decided on the ministry's proposal.
